Hello to all of you old fans on Lego Rock raiders :)

As many of you may have noticed, this game will not run on windows 7 or vista saying that it cannot find the designated file: "d3drm.dll"

I google'd it a bit and found a solution!

http://www.gamefaqs.com/boards/genmessage.php?board=197777&topic=26766394&page=36

the 7th. comment. a guy who fixed this issue. simply follow his instructions, and you will be running!

Hope it's helpful for any people out there.

btw, thanks for uploading

UPDATE ^

Just an important tip to mention that the guy forgot:
If it does not work when you put the d3drm.dll in C:/Windows/System32, then just put it in the C:/Windows/system folder.

Anyways, cheers, i'm out.

Thanks very much! My CD was glitching.

So I was on an ice level- oxygen was limited. I had 5 support stations, and rock raiders running around like insects. My 3.8GHz was lagging. Anyway, something glitched and none of my buildings got power, though I had over 100 energy crystals. :o lol 

Works great on Win7. I had to put it in the Windows/System folder.
Also, one of the fastest download times I've ever got.
Thanks again
Does it Work for windows 7?

very good however is quite laggy but it does work on windows 7. For windows 7 users disregard the help text given with torrent as wat it says doesn't work. if you get message saying you need d3drm.dll just open the disc with explorer go into directx6 and then again directx6 and it'll be in there :D have the fun :D

i have windows 7 and its not working for me. it installed fine and i got d3drm.dll and put it in the system folder, and when i try and run the program it just sits at a black screen. doesnt say its not responding, it just steadily builds up ram usage and uses a near constant 50% of my cpu. i tried different compatibility modes but none worked. any tips?
nevermind, i got it fixed. ended up haxing into the config file to disable avi movies O.o
i would like to thank whoever put this on hear this is on of my all time fav games

If you have the error with the "d3drm.dll" file, just look it up at http://www.dll-files.com/ . There you can download .dll files if you need them, place the .dll file inside >the game folder< or in the >system directory

The predicted DLL error came up on windows 7, however after simply moving the noted driver file into the System folder, it launched easily! However, the game started up about 200 pixels off-center from the screen, with no sound. It has also completely corrupted my directx. My resolution, even after a restart, now remains 720x640, down from 1280x768. Directx will no longer run, now will any programs that require it. Thanks... 

Will post again when and IF I can repair the damage to my computer, but I will definitely not be trying to run the game again, I'm tossing it straight to the trash and going out to buy the cd again.
